comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Right you are! The caption in the original Detroit Publishing Company catalog from 1905 says "Palladin," but the Wikipedia entry for this school includes a picture of the bridge described as "The Palladian bridge and lake that it spans were added in 1755," en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prior_Park_College -- Helena

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Separate Wikipedia entry for the house, a significant one in the history of architecture, which was named Prior Park, as in the caption on the print above: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prior_Park Separate Wikipedia entry on the garden, which is the prototypical "English Garden" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prior_Park_Landscape_Garden This is one of those rare places that looks pretty much the same now as in the 1890's:
